184762591.review:
This is one of my favorite games of all time (which probably says something about me, I don't know what though). There's a lot of content and it's very fun to play. The replay value is enormous, the graphics and effects are great, music and sound effects are good as well. There is a lot of content in the game as I've said before, a giant amount of weapons, armor, potions, gear in general.

That being said, it's actually crazy how unfinished this game is. Most of the enemies are the same, even some of the bosses, there are game breaking bugs, some of which require you to delete your character and create a new one because you're one hit away from dying... from any enemy. All of that to say, I seriously don't think this game is worth the $10 it's at right now, especially that the developer has completely abandoned the project, and I don't think they'll pick it up any time soon to fix it, though I hope that isn't the case and they'll return to it at some point.

All hope is not lost as there is a pretty active modding community since I last saw, I hope it hasn't died. I've seen some new mods since the last time I played, so at least some third-party development is still ongoing.

Either way, I love this game. Been playing it on and off since it came out, picked it back up again to play with my brother, which has been a great time even though we've died in the stupidest ways at the worst times. It's ok, we'll get back to where we left off, eventually.

If you love roguelikes and don't mind spending money on an overpriced (as I've said before) basically dead (except the modding community, I hope) game, then you should definitely buy Roguelands as I can guarantee you'll have a great time for the couple of hours you spend on it.

If you're not into roguelikes that much or it's your first time playing a roguelike, or you're trying to buy a game that you think you will enjoy with the last $10 of the whatever amount of money your mom gave you on your birthday, don't bother, spend it on some other game that's in better shape or on something completely different, it doesn't have to be a game per se.
